snippet: A strike over the oil price increase shut down much of the country, and news reports said several protesters were killed as the police sought to contain the demonstrations.
abstract: Tens of thousands of Nigerians take to the streets to protest sudden sharp rise in oil prices after the government abruptly ends fuel subsidies; at the same time, a national strike over the oil price increase shuts down much of the country.

byline.contributor: Musikilu Mojeed contributed reporting from Abuja, Nigeria

lead_paragraph: A strike over the oil price increase shut down much of the country, and news reports said several protesters were killed as the police sought to contain the demonstrations.

headline.seo: Nigerians Protest Oil Price Rise as Subsidies End
headline.main: Nigerians Protest Rise in Oil Prices
headline.print_headline: Nigerians Protest Rise in Oil Prices After Subsidies End
